description: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts, the greatest being odd.
comments: Fine's theorem: A026838(n) - a(n) = 1 if n = k(3k+1)/2, = -1 if n = k(3k-1)/2, = 0 otherwise (see A143062).Also number of partitions of n into an odd number of parts and such that parts of every size from 1 to the largest occur. Example: a(9)=4 because we have [3,2,2,1,1],[2,2,2,2,1],[2,2,1,1,1,1,1] and [1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1]. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 04 2006
links: I. Pak, On Fine's partition theorems, Dyson, Andrews and missed opportunities, Math. Intelligencer, 25 (No. 1, 2003), 10-16.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
